thread.title: Hollyoaks huge spoiler preview revealed: Funeral, hostage and stalker | Metro News
thread.title_full: Hollyoaks huge spoiler preview revealed: Funeral, hostage and stalker | Metro News

author: Duncan Lindsay For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Hollyoaks huge spoiler preview revealed: Funeral, hostage and stalker | Metro News
text:
Duncan Lindsay for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 4:25 pm (Picture: Lime Pictures) 
Certain residents of Hollyoaks are taking drastic action in upcoming scenes as Diego takes Esther prisoner, Peri turns to theft and Neeta ends up snatching baby Daniel when she meant to take Curtis for Grace. Elsewhere, someone seriously has it in for Leela too as she finds herself on the receiving end of a stalking campaign. 
Meanwhile, the Nightingales are facing dark days as Nathan is laid to rest and not even the return of Tabby can lift Marnie’s spirits as her grief threatens to push her into shocking action too. 
As residents are pushed to the limit with big consequences, here’s your big roundup of spoilers as well as a full episode guide. 10 Hollyoaks spoilers Tabby returns to Hollyoaks to support her family as Nathan is laid to rest. Grace asks Neeta to bring Curtis to her but she mistakenly snatches baby Daniel. Esther makes a discovery about Diego’s business so he holds her prisoner in the camper van hoping that her memory will lapse over what she has learned. Nathan’s funeral brings huge emotion for the Nightingales and as Marnie breaks down, she is pushed to the edge. Leela is convinced that Cameron is stalking her and someone lets themselves into her home and takes a picture of her sleeping. Nancy misses Charlie’s play for an appointment for new MS medication and he is angry with her. Peri dreads going back to school and steals an expensive necklace from the Emporium. Cleo gives Alfie food for thought over Jade and Tabby also has wise words for him. Adam urges Jesse to help him track down Grace as he remains convinced that she killed Darcy. Simone and Zack are left suspicious after an unusual turn of events. Monday 27th February (Picture: Lime Pictures) 
Tabby returns home to support her family during the funeral, which is emotional affair for all concerned. As the grief overwhelms her, Marnie breaks down while Mac struggles to cope with the guilt that he is feeling. 
Frankie confides in a suspicious Esther that she is seeing Diego and when Esther investigates in the campervan, she makes a big discovery. Sally catches Neeta skiving when she calls in sick when she is forced to look after Curtis for the day. Tuesday 28th February (Picture: Lime Pictures) 
Cleo gives Alfie food for thought after learning that he speaks to Jade and Tabby later sits down with him and tells him that she speaks to his grandfather all the time. Meanwhile, Marnie is driven to the edge by grief while Tabby tries fish and chips for the first time. 
Diego locks Esther in the campervan in the hope that she will forget what she has learned and Grace contacts Neeta to urge her to bring Curtis to her. Wednesday 1st March (Picture: Lime Pictures) 
Peri is dreading her first day back at school and finds herself driven to steal an expensive necklace from The Emporium. 
Leela supports Jesse as he struggles with baby Daniel and when Neeta swoops in to take Curtis for Grace, she accidentally snatches Daniel, leading to huge panic. Meanwhile, Zack and Simone’s suspicions are raised. Thursday 2nd March 
Adam urges Jesse to help him track down Grace, convinced that she killed Darcy. Leela is horrified to receive a threatening note. 
Nancy is prescribed new MS medicine but her first appointment clashes with Charlie’s play. Friday 3rd March 
Leela is convinced that Cameron is stalking her. Tegan and Courtney try to put her fears at rest but later, someone takes a picture of a sleeping Leela and sends it to her and she is horrified to realise that her stalker has been in her home. 
Charlie is upset with Nancy for missing the play. Metro Blogs is a place for opinions. These opinions belong to the author and are not necessarily shared by Metro. More
